intro: Xanthophyllum cordatum f. aequale, commonly known as the narrow-leaved goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface, and its yellow flowers are arranged in dense clusters. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. This variety is noted for its compact growth habit and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
